definition.name: Kind Cluster
definition.description: Create a kind (Kubernetes IN Docker) cluster
definition.author: The Helm authors

inputs.name: version
inputs.description: The kind version to use (default: v0.29.0)

inputs.name: config
inputs.description: The path to the kind config file

inputs.name: kubeconfig
inputs.description: The path to the kubeconfig config file

inputs.name: node_image
inputs.description: The Docker image for the cluster nodes

inputs.name: cluster_name
inputs.description: The name of the cluster to create (default: chart-testing)

inputs.name: wait
inputs.description: The duration to wait for the control plane to become ready (default: 60s)

inputs.name: kubectl_version
inputs.description: The kubectl version to use (default: v1.31.11)

inputs.name: registry
inputs.description: Whether to configure an insecure local registry (default: false)

inputs.name: registry_image
inputs.description: The registry image to use (default: registry:2)

inputs.name: registry_name
inputs.description: The registry name to use (default: kind-registry)

inputs.name: registry_port
inputs.description: The local port used to bind the registry (default: 5000)

inputs.name: registry_enable_delete
inputs.description: Enable delete operations on the registry (default: false)

inputs.name: install_only
inputs.description: Skips cluster creation, only install kind (default: false)

inputs.name: ignore_failed_clean
inputs.description: Whether to ignore the post-delete the cluster (default: false)

inputs.name: cloud_provider
inputs.description: Whether to use cloud provider loadbalancer (default: false)
